body_content.explanation: exploding or able to explode easily:
examples: An explosive device (= a bomb) was found at one of the capital's busiest stations this morning.

body_content.explanation: very loud and sudden, like an explosion:
examples: There was an explosive clap of thunder overhead.

body_content.explanation: An explosive situation or emotion is one in which strong feelings are loudly or violently expressed:
examples: The situation in some of America's cities has become explosive.
Capital punishment is an explosive issue.

body_content.explanation: An explosive increase is very large and quick:
examples: The last few years have seen an explosive increase in the number of homeless people on our streets.

body_content.explanation: used to describe a sports player, runner, etc. who is able to suddenly increase their speed or power while playing or running, or to describe this speed or power:
examples: He was one of the Premier League's most explosive players.
Trainers work on drills designed to promote explosive speed and physical agility.

body_content.explanation: a substance or piece of equipment that can cause explosions
